intro: Oxalis ottonis, commonly known as the Mexican wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins and produces small, delicate yellow flowers. The plant is often cultivated as a ornamental due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, thriving in temperate climates. Oxalis ottonis is also valued for its ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
